gurmukhi: jmDr jmdwVw jbr joDwNqk ijh nwie ]lUt kUt lIjq iqnY jy ibn bwNDy jwie ]24]
transliteration: Jamdhar Jamdaadaa Jabar Jodhaantak Jih Naae|| Loot Koot Leejat Tinai Je Bin Baandhe||24||
translation: Yamdhaar and Yamdadh and all other names of the weapons fro the destruction of the warriors, Thou hast folded up and bound all their power in Thyself.24.

gurmukhi: bwNk bjR ibCUE ibisiK ibrhbwn sB rUp ]ijn ko qum ikrpw krI Bey jgq ky BUp ]25]
transliteration: Baank Bajra Bichhodho Bisikh(i) Birabbaan Soubh Roop|| Jeen Ko Toum Kirpaa Karibhae Jagad Ke Bhoop||25||
translation: Baank, Bajar, Bichhuaa and the shafts of love, on whomsoever Thou didst shower Thy Grace, they all became the Sovereigns of the world.25.

gurmukhi: SsqR Syr smrwNq kir is`prwir SmSyr ]mukq jwl jm ky Bey ijmY kihXo iek byr ]26]
transliteration: Shastra Sher Samraant Kar(i) Souppdaar(i) Shamsher|| Moukat Jaal Jam Ke Bhae Jimai Kahiyo Ik Ber||26||
translation: The lion is Thy weapons like the sword in the war, which destroys the enemies; he, on whom, Thou didst shower Thy Grace, he was redeemed from th noose of Yama.26.

gurmukhi: sYP srohI S`qR Air swrMgwir ijh nwm ]sdw hmwry icq bso sdw kro mm kwm ]27]
transliteration: Saiphdarohishattra Ar(i) Saaranad(i) Jih Naam|| Sadaa Hamdare Chit Bado Sadaa Daro Man Kaam||27||
translation: Thou art the Saif and Sarohi and Thy Name is the destroyer of the enemies; You abide in our heart and fulfil our tasks.27.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI nwm mwlw purwxy sRI BgauqI ausqq piRQm iDAwie smwpqm squ suBm squ ]
transliteration: It(i) Srinaam Maalaa Puraane Sribhagadddioustat Pritham Dhiaae Samaaptam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||
translation: End of the first Chapter entitled “The Praise of the Primal Power” in Shri Nam-Mala Purana.
The Description of the Names of Discus

gurmukhi: kvc Sbd piRQmY kho AMq Sbd Air dyhu ]sB hI nwm kiRpwn ky jwn cqur jIA lyhu ]28]
transliteration: Kavach Shabad Prithmai Kaho Ant Shabad Ar(i) Deh(u)|| Sabh Hinaam Kridaan Ke Jaan Chatur Jeea Leh(u)||28||
translation: Putting the word “Kavach” in the beginning and adding the word Ar-deha at the end, the wise people know all the other names of Kripaan.28.

gurmukhi: SqR Sbd piRQmY kho AMq duSt pd BwKu ]sBY nwm jgMnwQ ko sdw hiRdY mo rwK ]29]
transliteration: Shatru Shabad Prithmai Kaho Ant Dousht Pad Bhaakh(u)|| Sabhai Naam Jagadnaath Ko Sadaa Hridai Mo Raakh||29||
translation: The word “Shatru” is uttered in the beginning and the word “Dusht” is spoken at the end and in this way all the names of Jagnnath are adopted in the heart.29.

gurmukhi: piRQI Sbd piRQmY Bno pwlk bhur aucwr ]skl nwm siRStyS ky sdw hiRdY mo Dwr ]30]
transliteration: Prithishabad Prithmai Bhano Paalak Bahur Ouchaar|| Sakal Naam Srishtesh Ke Sadaa Hridai Mo Dhaar||30||
translation: Saying the word “Prithvi” in the beginning and then uttering the word “Paalak” all the Names of the Lord are stuffed in the mind.30.

gurmukhi: siRSt nwm pihly kho bhur aucwro nwQ ]skl nwmu mm eIs ky sdw bso jIA swQ ]31]
transliteration: Srishat Naam Pahile Kaho Bahur Ouchdaro Naath|| Sakal Naam(u) Mam Is Ke Sadaa Bado Jeea Saath||31||
translation: Uttering the word “Sarishti” in the beginning and then the word “Nath”, all the Names of the Lord are adopted in the heart.31.

gurmukhi: isMG Sbd BwKo pRKm bwhn bhur aucwir ]sBY nwm jgmwq ky lIjhu su kib suDwir ]32]
transliteration: Singh Shabad Bhaakho Pratham Baahan Bahur Oucdaar(i)|| Sabhai Naam Jamaat Ke Leejoh Su Kahisuddaar(i)||32||
translation: Uttering the word “Sarishti” in the beginning and then the word “Vahan”, the poets may in this way say all the Names of Durga, the mother of the world.32.

gurmukhi: irpu KMfn mMfn jgq Kl KMfn jg mwih ]qw ko nwm aucwrIAY ijh sun duK tir jwih ]33]
transliteration: Rip(u) Khanndan Jagad Khal Khanndan Jag Maahe|| Taa Ko Naam Oucdareeai Jih Soun Doukh Tar(i) Jaahe||33||
translation: That Lord is the destroyer of he enemies, Creator of the world and also the Vanquisher of the foolish people in this world. His Name should be remembered, by hearing which all the suffering come to an end.33.
